content.description: left hand on a crimp in a small hueco feature and right hand in a small pocket. go left hand out to another pocket and right hand up to a nice jug. straight up to top out.
Start on a big hueco under the roof. Make your way out of the roof and on to the face via more good huecos to get to an obvious sidepull. Continue up through a pinch and more huecos to top out.
content.location: A few feet before Acoustic Elvis. Look for the obvious sidepull.

content.description: stand start on right hand sidepull and left hand mono stack. go left hand to hold in the hueco and up. this route is pronounced "Dow" and also has a sit start called "TaDow" that is possibly unrepeated.
content.location: to the right of the reach starting under an obvious large round hueco with a green water streak.

content.description: come out of the small over hang to committing slopers on the lip and a pocket above.
content.location: right of "oscar the grouch" and left of "cajun queen" on the smaller bulge wall.

content.description: Start on the large hueco about chest height. Left to a good hold, then right to another large sidepull, undercling hueco.
content.location: Large huecos in the middle of The Pit wall

content.description: Start in pockets, go right hand to obvious crimp and a big move out of the roof to good holds. I recommend cleaning your top out holds before getting on it.
content.location: stand start 10ft right of "acoustic elvis"/"moment of clarity"

content.description: start on gastoning right facing crimp. long move out of roof to a pocket edge and up on slopers.
Start on Acoustic Elvis and finish the heady top out.
From good holds come out left hand to a thin crimp and try your best to go right hand to the sloping lip. from here follow pockets slightly up and left.
content.location: stand start between "cant stop the wang" and "the reach"

content.description: Start in two pockets at about 7’. Move up and left to the hueco bucket in the roof, then straight out and up the head wall on bad pockets.
content.location: Between Choppy Seas and Can’t Stop The Wang

content.description: Same start as Zen, taking a more direct approach ignoring the sidepull flake out right. Grab a tiny crimp and dyno straight up to hueco and continue to top out.

stand start on obvious stacked huecos. left hand to small 2 finger pocket, toe hook and right hand to a sloping pinch. from here jump to good pocket while releasing the toe hook. watch out for the swing down the hill.
content.location: to the right of partial levitation.

content.description: sit start and climb straight up through good holds to a large accurate right hand move to a 3 finger pocket. left hand to a large jug pocket out of the roof and a fun mantle.
content.location: sit start on large obvious jugs under the middle of the traverse.

content.description: Start on a large orange flake. Traverse left across good pockets, ledges, huecos, and underclings and step off for v-weenie and top out for the send. Traverse
content.protection: Crashpads. The landing is pretty rocky.
content.location: First climb on Pit Wall. Look for the large, orange flake.

content.description: Catlin has the same start as Zen. Begin in the two huecos moving right through the positive shallow pockets and set up for a dynamic move from a sharp two finger pocket to a large hueco. From here the top out is straight up with good holds.
content.protection: Spotters are nice for the last move, especially due to the level of commitment.
content.location: Right side of "the Pit" between Zen and Acoustic Elvis.

content.description: start in horizontal slot and fire out to faint 2 finger pocket and pull the roof, exit right or left.
content.location: stand start between "king krosly" and "lopsand delima"

content.description: move up into small dihedral feature through painful pockets.
content.location: to the right of "swamp mamma" on the smaller bulge wall in the dihedral.

content.description: Start on low shelf with high feet. Move up to a good crimp, and .....another crimp. Set up for a long move to a sharp pocket(finish).
content.location: Just beyond Caitlin(a line of good pockets moving up from left to right)on the low shelf.

content.description: Big overhangs, classic problems. The Pit Wall has some of the most classic lines in Rogers Park.
